TopicTitle: RocktCo Industries Orbital Parts Set + Sneak peek of new set on page 2! WIP 4!

Articles.Content:
RocktCo Industries is proud to present.

RocktCo Industries Orbital Parts Set

v1.00

DOWNLOAD:

http://www./?km91346jifpbjjs

please take a second and read the install note.

As always, C&C are wellcome, if you find something wrong please post a comment.

Cheers and happy flights!

Wow, those are some really nice parts you made there

Downloaded.
thanks! enjoy!

beautifull parts. I really gotta step up my modelling.

The parachute only has 2 modes - non-deployed, and totally deployed. Even if it\'s above 10km height and non-functioning, it shows its deployed animation. Is that intended?

the parachute...well i couldnt fix that, its a problem related to the .DAE exporter im using, unfortunately i couldnt find a way around this problem, even with other export plugs; anyway lets just say ITS OFFICIALLY INTENDED. 8)

Thanks for your comment anyway feanor.
Are any of the other part-makers out there willing to export it for you, to get it right? I love that chute, and it would be even better if it could be made to work as intended.

if it isn\'t to much trouble could you Make a .Zip file... for some reason i cannot git this to download :\'(

Please and thankyou

Semininja: well i guess it will be nice, if someone want to re-export the chute , please go for it.

Caveman max: there you go, enjoy.

Download.ZIP:

http://www./?fqtka04mg9gkvlb

Amazing texture work. Definitely some of the best I\'ve seen for Kerbal so far.

What fuel tank are you using in the middle of that screenshot? Between the RCS and Orbit tanks?
Thank you so much Zuff! glad you liked it, between the two tanks is an advanced SAS module (the standard game one)
I\'d use this, but the textures have way too much color noise, But nice parts anyway.
MC3craze: color noise?, could you post a screenshot?, just to see whats wrong and fix it. thanks
I think maybe he just means they\'re rather bright and colorful, compared to the very simply textured parts found in most sets/stock. Not actually something defective
I think they look swell, myself.
all right then! ;D i was worried that maybe something was wrong with the textures.. anyway thanks for your comments, im so glad you people liked em. cheers!
That is probably the best part designing I have seen as of yet. Honestly great job and keep up the creativity.

Thanks so much Brigs! i really apreciate all the comments and suport.

as for now, i give ya an sneakpeak of the new set im working on, based on a real one this time.

still needs a lot of working, detailing, and texturing; but its taking shape. hope ya like em.

upcoming in a week o two. Cheers!

wip 1:

wip 2: update on the model

wip 3: engines + cargo hold

wip 4: update on Kliper
Is that Kliper?
indeeed. 8)

nice!

I\'m gonna need you to go ahead and work through the weekend and have that ready for Monday. Tomorrow.
TOMORROW?? :

My only complaint, the textures really don\'t fit with KSP. Waaay to grungey with too many contrasting colors. KSP has a fairly simple palette, tinted greys for the most part with yellow on hazard stripes and small amounts of other colors on engine piping and stuff.

yeah you`re right, i tend to use more oranges, blues and overall high contrast in my textures... but this is cause they are not real world rocket parts; and i may be wrong, but i see a colorfull game (the editor, icons, and the environment, they are all colorfull or at least, thats the way i see em), and thats what i try to match and try to make better in my parts. but yeah, the colors may be too shinny and contrasty.

anyway im aware that real parts are way less colorfull, and this new set im working will be as acurate as i can be in colors and texture.

Thanks for the headsup comment Nova, really apreciated man. :thumbup:

Oh woe is me!

When will someone release a soyuz model that actually has correct staging?

Still looking forward to your release, nonetheless

Feanor: well... this is the stage set i plan to use, as far as i researched its correct. all liquid, with RD-108 cluster with verniers or a single RD_120K in first and second (to save modeling =P ) and an RD-0146E in third. right?

i splited the second stage in two tanks, to re-use the top one in the third stage, and save texture size. i think its more practical.

thanks for your comment!
